result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D Tweedie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

supervisions.notes:
REPORT TO PROBATION ON 8/17/15 BY NOON.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 15CF143.

miscConds.notes:
Complete High School Diploma and obtain employment.
.

Def to undergo Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with co-actors in this incident.

No contact with Robert B. except a letter of apology given to his PO and delivered to the District Attorneys office.
.

Upon successful completion of all terms and conditions of probation, the record will be expunged under 973.015.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.
.

supervisions.notes:
TIME SERVED

Unpaid Court costs/fees are converted to a Civil Judgment
.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with La Crosse Co case 15CF143
.

records.addlTxt: Revoked- sentenced to Time served

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing after Revocation hedl 6-18-17 w/ TWB - filed by Tina Bjerke

3:44 pm Def in court w/ Atty Patricia Linda O'Neil.  Def in custody.  Noel A Lawrence appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The victim rights act has been complied.  Victim comments.  Lawrence comments and leaves the sentence to the Court.  O'Neil comments and asks for credit on the initial confinement part.  Tweedie comments.  Court comments.
SENTENCES:
15CF-240 - 4 mos CJ w/4 mos credit - CC converted to a CV judgment
15CF-143 - 1 year CJ w/270 days credit - CC converted to a CV justment
14CF-806 - 6 years prison 
1 year Initial confinement w/333 days credit - consecutive to 15CF-143 first and then 15CF-240
5 years extended supervision
Conditions:
Live with the Clemersons'
Curfew from 9 pm to 6 am - PO can adjust that as they see fit
No alcohol or controlled substances w/o Rx from a Dr.
Random testing
CC and Restitution if any
He is eligible for CIP or ERP
DOC Balance Inquiry
from PO Jenna Rose   re: Sentencing After Revocation / Rev Summary
Terminated regular
Nikki Swayne
